intro: Tylophora dalatensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese star vine, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by elliptical berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
